Dear Mr. Barcus;
'This letter is in reply to yours of June 23 to Mr* John White and to
me, regarding a "Rational Education television & Radio Week*”
Franklin Bouvsma of WSayne State has been urging this on us for over
a year. I think It *s a fine idea, if it can be effectively done.
I am sending a copy of this reply to John White. If he feels it
deserves a cooperative effort, I would be happy to appoint you and
Franklin Bouwsma, on behalf of the MSB, to join with individuals who
might be designated by the Center, to try to develop a plan for such
a ’’Week, * with recommendations for appropriate proclamations, announce¬
ments, station breaks, special programs, and other efforts.
I am also sending a copy of this to Mr. Elmer Sulzer, Chairman of the
Public Relation© Committee, Mr. Bernard Kamins in Los .Angeles, who is
a member of that committee, and well-placed in both experience and
location to assistp; and our Legal Counsel, Leonard Marks who would,
perhaps have some ideas of steps which might be taken in Washington.
We thank you most sincerely for your thoughtful suggestion, and hope we
may be able to come up with some specific way of implenenting this idea.
I shall be away during July but Mr. Harold Hill, in this office — whose
ideas I have incorporated with mine in this letter — will be here to
help move it along if action is needed during that time.
